datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

nkey.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: fwgrp

POST.summary:
Create object(s) in this table.
 Access Group: fwgrp

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: fwgrp

DELETE.summary:
Delete this specific resource.
 Access Group: fwgrp

uuid.name: uuid
uuid.help: Universally Unique Identifier (UUID; automatically assigned but can be manually reset).

ip-version.name: ip-version
ip-version.help: Apply this traffic shaping policy to IPv4 or IPv6 traffic.

options.help: Use IPv4 addressing for Configuration Method.
options.description: Use IPv4 addressing for Configuration Method

options.help: Use IPv6 addressing for Configuration Method.
options.description: Use IPv6 addressing for Configuration Method

srcaddr.name: srcaddr
srcaddr.help: IPv4 source address and address group names.

dstaddr.name: dstaddr
dstaddr.help: IPv4 destination address and address group names.

srcaddr6.name: srcaddr6
srcaddr6.help: IPv6 source address and address group names.

dstaddr6.name: dstaddr6
dstaddr6.help: IPv6 destination address and address group names.

internet-service.name: internet-service
internet-service.help: Enable/disable use of Internet Services for this policy. If enabled, destination address and service are not used.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable use of Internet Service in shaping-policy.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable use of Internet Service in shaping-policy

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable use of Internet Service in shaping-policy.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable use of Internet Service in shaping-policy

internet-service-src.name: internet-service-src
internet-service-src.help: Enable/disable use of Internet Services in source for this policy. If enabled, source address is not used.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable use of Internet Service source in shaping-policy.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable use of Internet Service source in shaping-policy

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable use of Internet Service source in shaping-policy.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable use of Internet Service source in shaping-policy

internet-service-src-custom-group.name: internet-service-src-custom-group
internet-service-src-custom-group.help: Custom Internet Service source group name.

users.name: users
users.help: Apply this traffic shaping policy to individual users that have authenticated with the FortiGate.

groups.name: groups
groups.help: Apply this traffic shaping policy to user groups that have authenticated with the FortiGate.

application.name: application
application.help: IDs of one or more applications that this shaper applies application control traffic shaping to.

app-category.name: app-category
app-category.help: IDs of one or more application categories that this shaper applies application control traffic shaping to.

app-group.name: app-group
app-group.help: One or more application group names.

url-category.name: url-category
url-category.help: IDs of one or more FortiGuard Web Filtering categories that this shaper applies traffic shaping to.

tos-mask.name: tos-mask
tos-mask.help: Non-zero bit positions are used for comparison while zero bit positions are ignored.

tos.name: tos
tos.help: ToS (Type of Service) value used for comparison.

traffic-shaper.name: traffic-shaper
traffic-shaper.help: Traffic shaper to apply to traffic forwarded by the firewall policy.

traffic-shaper-reverse.name: traffic-shaper-reverse
traffic-shaper-reverse.help: Traffic shaper to apply to response traffic received by the firewall policy.

per-ip-shaper.name: per-ip-shaper
per-ip-shaper.help: Per-IP traffic shaper to apply with this policy.

diffserv-forward.name: diffserv-forward
diffserv-forward.help: Enable to change packet's DiffServ values to the specified diffservcode-forward value.

diffserv-reverse.name: diffserv-reverse
diffserv-reverse.help: Enable to change packet's reverse (reply) DiffServ values to the specified diffservcode-rev value.

diffservcode-forward.name: diffservcode-forward
diffservcode-forward.help: Change packet's DiffServ to this value.

diffservcode-rev.name: diffservcode-rev
diffservcode-rev.help: Change packet's reverse (reply) DiffServ to this value.
